subject: Data
title: Spotting Cherry-Picked Statistics
description: A quick, practical guide to Spotting Cherry-Picked Statistics.

hook.text: A politician says 'unemployment fell for 12 straight months!' They don't mention it rose for the 24 months before.

buildup.text: Cherry-picking selects only the data points that support your argument while hiding the rest.

discovery.text: The fix is simple: ask for the full dataset, the full time range, and the full context.

twist.text: Both sides of every political debate cherry-pick statistics. Recognizing it is a non-partisan skill.

climax.text: Data literacy isn't about trusting or distrusting data â€” it's about knowing what questions to ask.

punchline.text: If they only show you part of the picture, the rest is probably ugly.

quiz.question: What's the best defense against cherry-picked statistics?
options: Asking for the full dataset and context
